meanings.definition: A person or thing that shocks or surprises.
meanings.sent1: The horror movie had many shockers that made the audience jump.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected plot twist in the book was full of shockers.
meanings.sent3: The magician's rabbit was a real shocker when it suddenly appeared in his hat.
meanings.sent4: The final scene of the play was a shocker, leaving everyone in the audience gasping.
meanings.sent5: The surprise party was a shocker for the birthday girl, who had no idea it was planned.

meanings.definition: A shocking or surprising event or piece of news.
meanings.sent1: The news of the earthquake was a real shocker for the small town.
meanings.sent2: The scandal in the newspaper was full of shockers that kept readers hooked.
meanings.sent3: The cat wearing a hat was a shocker for the dog, who had never seen such a thing before.
meanings.sent4: The sudden thunderstorm was a shocker, catching everyone off guard.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected win was a shocker for the underdog team, who celebrated wildly.
